verses.kjv: In the eighth month, in the second year of Darius, came the word of the LORD unto Zechariah, the son of Berechiah, the son of Iddo the prophet, saying,
verses.web: In the eighth month, in the second year of Darius, LORD’s word came to Zechariah the son of Berechiah, the son of Iddo, the prophet, saying,
verses.ct: During the 8th month of King Darius's 2nd year, the LORD spoke to the prophet Zechariah, son of Berechiah and grandson of Iddo.

verses.kjv: The LORD hath been sore displeased with your fathers.
verses.web: “LORD was very displeased with your fathers.
verses.ct: "The LORD was deeply angry with your ancestors."

verses.kjv: Therefore say thou unto them, Thus saith the LORD of hosts; Turn ye unto me, saith the LORD of hosts, and I will turn unto you, saith the LORD of hosts.
verses.web: Therefore tell them: LORD of Armies says: ‘Return to me,’ says LORD of Armies, ‘and I will return to you,’ says LORD of Armies.
verses.ct: "So tell the people this: The LORD of hosts says, 'Come back to me,' declares the LORD of hosts, 'and I will come back to you,' says the LORD of hosts."

verses.kjv: Be ye not as your fathers, unto whom the former prophets have cried, saying, Thus saith the LORD of hosts; Turn ye now from your evil ways, and from your evil doings: but they did not hear, nor hearken unto me, saith the LORD.
verses.web: Don’t you be like your fathers, to whom the former prophets proclaimed, saying: LORD of Armies says, ‘Return now from your evil ways, and from your evil doings;’ but they didn’t hear, nor listen to me, says LORD.
verses.ct: "Don't be like your ancestors. The earlier prophets pleaded with them, saying, 'The LORD of hosts says: Turn away from your evil ways and your wicked behavior.' But they refused to listen. They paid no attention to me," declares the LORD.

verses.kjv: Your fathers, where are they? and the prophets, do they live for ever?
verses.web: Your fathers, where are they? And the prophets, do they live forever?
verses.ct: "Where are your ancestors now? And the prophets — did they live forever?

verses.kjv: But my words and my statutes, which I commanded my servants the prophets, did they not take hold of your fathers? and they returned and said, Like as the LORD of hosts thought to do unto us, according to our ways, and according to our doings, so hath he dealt with us.
verses.web: But my words and my decrees, which I commanded my servants the prophets, didn’t they overtake your fathers? “Then they repented and said, ‘Just as LORD of Armies determined to do to us, according to our ways, and according to our practices, so he has dealt with us.’ ”
verses.ct: But the warnings and commands I gave through my servants the prophets — didn't those catch up with your ancestors? They finally came around and admitted, 'The LORD of hosts has dealt with us exactly as we deserved, punishing us for the way we lived and the things we did.'"

verses.kjv: Upon the four and twentieth day of the eleventh month, which is the month Sebat, in the second year of Darius, came the word of the LORD unto Zechariah, the son of Berechiah, the son of Iddo the prophet, saying,
verses.web: On the twenty-fourth day of the eleventh month, which is the month Shebat, in the second year of Darius, LORD’s word came to Zechariah the son of Berechiah, the son of Iddo, the prophet, saying,
verses.ct: On the 24th day of the 11th month — the month of Sebat — during the 2nd year of King Darius, the LORD spoke again to the prophet Zechariah, son of Berechiah and grandson of Iddo.

verses.kjv: I saw by night, and behold a man riding upon a red horse, and he stood among the myrtle trees that were in the bottom; and behind him were there red horses, speckled, and white.
verses.web: “I had a vision in the night, and behold, a man riding on a red horse, and he stood among the myrtle trees that were in a ravine; and behind him there were red, brown, and white horses.
verses.ct: During the night I had a vision. I saw a man riding a red horse, standing among the myrtle trees in a ravine. Behind him were red, brown, and white horses.

verses.kjv: Then said I, O my lord, what are these? And the angel that talked with me said unto me, I will shew thee what these be.
verses.web: Then I asked, ‘My lord, what are these?’ ” The angel who talked with me said to me, “I will show you what these are.”
verses.ct: I asked, "My lord, what do these mean?" The angel who was speaking with me said, "I'll show you what they are."

verses.kjv: And the man that stood among the myrtle trees answered and said, These are they whom the LORD hath sent to walk to and fro through the earth.
verses.web: The man who stood among the myrtle trees answered, “They are the ones LORD has sent to go back and forth through the earth.”
verses.ct: Then the man standing among the myrtle trees explained, "These are the ones the LORD has sent to patrol the earth."

verses.kjv: And they answered the angel of the LORD that stood among the myrtle trees, and said, We have walked to and fro through the earth, and, behold, all the earth sitteth still, and is at rest.
verses.web: They reported to LORD’s angel who stood among the myrtle trees, and said, “We have walked back and forth through the earth, and behold, all the earth is at rest and in peace.”
verses.ct: The riders reported back to the angel of the LORD standing among the myrtle trees, "We've patrolled the whole earth, and everything is calm and at peace."

verses.kjv: Then the angel of the LORD answered and said, O LORD of hosts, how long wilt thou not have mercy on Jerusalem and on the cities of Judah, against which thou hast had indignation these threescore and ten years?
verses.web: Then LORD’s angel replied, “O LORD of Armies, how long will you not have mercy on Jerusalem and on the cities of Judah, against which you have had indignation these seventy years?”
verses.ct: Then the angel of the LORD cried out, "LORD of hosts, how long will you withhold your mercy from Jerusalem and the cities of Judah? You've been angry with them for 70 years now!"

verses.kjv: And the LORD answered the angel that talked with me with good words and comfortable words.
verses.web: LORD answered the angel who talked with me with kind and comforting words.
verses.ct: The LORD responded to the angel who had been speaking with me, and his words were kind and full of comfort.

verses.kjv: So the angel that communed with me said unto me, Cry thou, saying, Thus saith the LORD of hosts; I am jealous for Jerusalem and for Zion with a great jealousy.
verses.web: So the angel who talked with me said to me, “Proclaim, saying, ‘LORD of Armies says: “I am jealous for Jerusalem and for Zion with a great jealousy.
verses.ct: So the angel told me, "Announce this message: The LORD of hosts says, 'I burn with fierce jealousy for Jerusalem and Zion.

verses.kjv: And I am very sore displeased with the heathen that are at ease: for I was but a little displeased, and they helped forward the affliction.
verses.web: I am very angry with the nations that are at ease; for I was but a little displeased, but they added to the calamity.”
verses.ct: I am furious with the nations that sit comfortably at ease. I was only a little angry with my people, but those nations made the suffering far worse than I intended.'

verses.kjv: Therefore thus saith the LORD; I am returned to Jerusalem with mercies: my house shall be built in it, saith the LORD of hosts, and a line shall be stretched forth upon Jerusalem.
verses.web: Therefore LORD says: “I have returned to Jerusalem with mercy. My house shall be built in it,” says LORD of Armies, “and a line shall be stretched out over Jerusalem.” ’
verses.ct: "Therefore the LORD says, 'I have returned to Jerusalem with mercy. My temple will be rebuilt there,' declares the LORD of hosts, 'and the measuring line will be stretched across Jerusalem once again.'"

verses.kjv: Cry yet, saying, Thus saith the LORD of hosts; My cities through prosperity shall yet be spread abroad; and the LORD shall yet comfort Zion, and shall yet choose Jerusalem.
verses.web: “Proclaim further, saying, ‘LORD of Armies says: “My cities will again overflow with prosperity, and LORD will again comfort Zion, and will again choose Jerusalem.” ’ ”
verses.ct: "Announce this as well: The LORD of hosts says, 'My cities will once again overflow with prosperity. The LORD will comfort Zion again and will once more choose Jerusalem as his own.'"

verses.kjv: Then lifted I up mine eyes, and saw, and behold four horns.
verses.web: I lifted up my eyes, and saw, and behold, four horns.
verses.ct: Then I looked up and saw 4 horns.

verses.kjv: And I said unto the angel that talked with me, What be these? And he answered me, These are the horns which have scattered Judah, Israel, and Jerusalem.
verses.web: I asked the angel who talked with me, “What are these?” He answered me, “These are the horns which have scattered Judah, Israel, and Jerusalem.”
verses.ct: I asked the angel who was speaking with me, "What are these?" He answered, "These are the horns that scattered Judah, Israel, and Jerusalem."

verses.kjv: And the LORD shewed me four carpenters.
verses.web: LORD showed me four craftsmen.
verses.ct: Then the LORD showed me 4 craftsmen.

verses.kjv: Then said I, What come these to do? And he spake, saying, These are the horns which have scattered Judah, so that no man did lift up his head: but these are come to fray them, to cast out the horns of the Gentiles, which lifted up their horn over the land of Judah to scatter it.
verses.web: Then I asked, “What are these coming to do?” He said, “These are the horns which scattered Judah, so that no man lifted up his head; but these have come to terrify them, to cast down the horns of the nations, which lifted up their horn against the land of Judah to scatter it.”
verses.ct: I asked, "What are they coming to do?" He replied, "These horns are the powers that scattered Judah so completely that no one could even raise their head. But these craftsmen have come to terrify them and to throw down the horns of the nations that raised their power against the land of Judah to scatter its people."
